($90 - $85) + ($90 - $85 * 2) - $2.20 - $4.50 = $9.80

Note: The max gain is the difference between the strike price of the call that is exercised and the strike price of the call that is not exercised, minus the premium received for selling the call, plus the premium paid for buying the call. The max loss is the difference between the strike price of the call that is exercised and the strike price of the call that is not exercised, minus the premium received for selling the call, plus the premium paid for buying the call, plus the difference between the strike price of the call that is not exercised and the sale price of the stock that is bought back to close the position.

data.sampled: [ $410.00 ] [ $410.00, $404.00 ]​ If the stock price at expiration is equal to or greater than $410, the call option will be exercised and you will receive the stock price. If the stock price at expiration is less than or equal to $404, the call option will expire worthless. The breakeven stock prices are therefore $410 for the bought call and $411.05 for the sold call (ignoring transaction costs).
